intro: Chaetogastra longipilosa, commonly known as the long-hairy chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which are covered in fine, dense pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow and arranged in a compact head, resembling a daisy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
